name: List of Programming Languages and Frameworks
description: A list of various programming languages and frameworks.

itemListElement.name: Unity
itemListElement.description: Unity is a cross-platform game engine used to develop video games for PC, consoles, mobile devices and websites.
itemListElement.keywords: Unity, Unity3D, Game Engine, 3D Game Development
itemListElement.operatingSystem: Windows, macOS, Linux, Android, iOS, WebGL

itemListElement.name: Pygame
itemListElement.description: Pygame is a set of Python modules designed for writing video games.
itemListElement.keywords: Python, Pygame, Game Development, Game Programming, 2D Games

itemListElement.name: Panda3D
itemListElement.description: Panda3D is a game engine, a framework for 3D rendering and game development for Python and C++ programs.
itemListElement.keywords: Python, Panda3D, Game Engine, Game Development, 3D Games

itemListElement.name: React
itemListElement.description: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces.
itemListElement.keywords: React, ReactJS, JavaScript Library, Front-end Development

itemListElement.name: Vue.js
itemListElement.description: Vue.js is an open-source JavaScript framework for building user interfaces and single-page applications.
itemListElement.keywords: Vue.js, VueJS, JavaScript Framework, Front-end Development

itemListElement.name: Selenium
itemListElement.description: Selenium is a suite of tools to automate web browsers across many platforms.
itemListElement.keywords: Selenium, Selenium WebDriver, Automated Testing, Web Testing

itemListElement.name: Swing
itemListElement.description: Swing is a GUI widget toolkit for Java, which allows the creation of desktop applications with a graphical user interface.

itemListElement.name: GlassFish
itemListElement.description: GlassFish is a free and open-source application server for building and deploying web applications on the Java EE platform.

itemListElement.name: Tomcat7
itemListElement.description: Apache Tomcat 7 is an open source software implementation of the Java Servlet, JavaServer Pages, Java Expression Language, and Java WebSocket technologies.

itemListElement.name: Vim
itemListElement.description: Vim is a text editor program for Unix-like operating systems that provides powerful editing capabilities and supports many programming languages.
itemListElement.keywords: Vim, Text Editor, Command Line Interface, CLI, Unix-like

itemListElement.name: GIMP
itemListElement.description: GIMP is a free and open-source raster graphics editor used for image retouching and editing, free-form drawing, and converting between different image formats.
itemListElement.keywords: GIMP, GNU Image Manipulation Program, Image Editor, raster graphics editor, free and open-source
